Determine the safety window length of the next cohort

Source: R/Rules-methods.R
windowLength.Rd

This function determines the safety window length of the next cohort.

windowLength(safetyWindow, size, ...)

# S4 method for SafetyWindowSize
windowLength(safetyWindow, size, data, ...)

# S4 method for SafetyWindowConst
windowLength(safetyWindow, size, ...)

Arguments

safetyWindow

The rule, an object of class SafetyWindow
size

The next cohort size
...

additional arguments
data

The data input, an object of class DataDA

Value

the windowLength as a list of safety window parameters (patientGap, patientFollow, patientFollowMin)

Functions

  • windowLength,SafetyWindowSize-method: Determine safety window length based on the cohort size

  • windowLength,SafetyWindowConst-method: Constant safety window length

Examples

# Create the data
data <- DataDA(x=c(0.1, 0.5, 1.5, 3, 6, 10, 10, 10),
               y=c(0, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0),
               doseGrid=
                 c(0.1, 0.5, 1.5, 3, 6,
                   seq(from=10, to=80, by=2)),
               u=c(42,30,15,5,20,25,30,60),
               t0=c(0,-15,-30,-40,-55,-70,-75,-85),
               Tmax=60)
#> Used default patient IDs!
#> Used best guess cohort indices!
#> Error in validObject(.Object): invalid class “DataDA” object: t0 must be of type double, nObs length, sorted non-negative

# Initialize the CRM model used to model the data
npiece_ <- 10
lambda_prior<-function(k){
  npiece_/(data@Tmax*(npiece_-k+0.5))
}

model<-DALogisticLogNormal(mean=c(-0.85,1),
                           cov=matrix(c(1,-0.5,-0.5,1),nrow=2),
                           refDose=56,
                           npiece=npiece_,
                           l=as.numeric(t(apply(as.matrix(c(1:npiece_),1,npiece_),2,lambda_prior))),
                           C_par=2)
#> Error in FUN(newX[, i], ...): trying to get slot "Tmax" from an object of a basic class ("function") with no slots

# Set-up some MCMC parameters and generate samples from the posterior
options <- McmcOptions(burnin=100,
                       step=2,
                       samples=200)
set.seed(94)
samples <- mcmc(data, model, options)
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'model' in selecting a method for function 'mcmc': object 'model' not found

# Define the rule for dose increments and calculate the maximum dose allowed
myIncrements <- IncrementsRelative(intervals=c(0, 20),
                                   increments=c(1, 0.33))
nextMaxDose <- maxDose(myIncrements,
                       data=data)
#> Error in (function (classes, fdef, mtable) {    methods <- .findInheritedMethods(classes, fdef, mtable)    if (length(methods) == 1L)         return(methods[[1L]])    else if (length(methods) == 0L) {        cnames <- paste0("\"", vapply(classes, as.character,             ""), "\"", collapse = ", ")        stop(gettextf("unable to find an inherited method for function %s for signature %s",             sQuote(fdef@generic), sQuote(cnames)), domain = NA)    }    else stop("Internal error in finding inherited methods; didn't return a unique method",         domain = NA)})(list(structure("IncrementsRelative", package = "crmPack"),     "function"), new("nonstandardGenericFunction", .Data = function (increments,     data, ...) {    ans <- {        standardGeneric("maxDose")    }    .valueClassTest(ans, "numeric", "maxDose")}, generic = structure("maxDose", package = "crmPack"), package = "crmPack",     group = list(), valueClass = "numeric", signature = c("increments",     "data"), default = NULL, skeleton = (function (increments,         data, ...)     stop("invalid call in method dispatch to 'maxDose' (no default method)",         domain = NA))(increments, data, ...)), <environment>): unable to find an inherited method for function ‘maxDose’ for signature ‘"IncrementsRelative", "function"’

# Define the rule which will be used to select the next best dose
# based on the class 'NextBestNCRM'
myNextBest <- NextBestNCRM(target=c(0.2, 0.35),
                           overdose=c(0.35, 1),
                           maxOverdoseProb=0.25)

# Calculate the next best dose
doseRecommendation <- nextBest(myNextBest,
                               doselimit=nextMaxDose,
                               samples=samples, model=model, data=data)
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'doselimit' in selecting a method for function 'nextBest': object 'nextMaxDose' not found

# Define the rule which will be used to select the next cohort size
# based on the class 'CohortSizeConst'
mySize <- CohortSizeConst(size=3)

# Determine the cohort size for the next cohort
sizeRecommendation <- size(mySize, dose=doseRecommendation$value, data = data)
#> Error in size(mySize, dose = doseRecommendation$value, data = data): object 'doseRecommendation' not found

# Rule for the safety window length:
#   -having patientGap as (0,7,3,3,...) for cohort size <4
#   -and having patientGap as (0,9,5,5,...) for cohort size >=4
myWindowLength <- SafetyWindowSize(patientGap = list(c(7,3),c(9,5)),
                                   sizeInterval = c(1,4),
                                   patientFollow = 7,
                                   patientFollowMin = 14)

# Determine the safety window parameters for the next cohort
windowLength(myWindowLength, size=sizeRecommendation)
#> Error in findInterval(x = size, vec = safetyWindow@sizeIntervals): object 'sizeRecommendation' not found


# Create the data
data <- DataDA(x=c(0.1, 0.5, 1.5, 3, 6, 10, 10, 10),
               y=c(0, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0),
               doseGrid=
                 c(0.1, 0.5, 1.5, 3, 6,
                   seq(from=10, to=80, by=2)),
               u=c(42,30,15,5,20,25,30,60),
               t0=c(0,-15,-30,-40,-55,-70,-75,-85),
               Tmax=60)

#> Used best guess cohort indices!

  npiece_/(data@Tmax*(npiece_-k+0.5))
}

                           cov=matrix(c(1,-0.5,-0.5,1),nrow=2),
                           refDose=56,
                           npiece=npiece_,

                           C_par=2)
#> Error in FUN(newX[, i], ...): trying to get slot "Tmax" from an object of a basic class ("function") with no slots

# Set-up some MCMC parameters and generate samples from the posterior

                       step=2,
                       samples=200)
set.seed(94)
samples <- mcmc(data, model, options)
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'model' in selecting a method for function 'mcmc': object 'model' not found

# Define the rule for dose increments and calculate the maximum dose allowed
myIncrements <- IncrementsRelative(intervals=c(0, 20),
                                   increments=c(1, 0.33))
nextMaxDose <- maxDose(myIncrements,
                       data=data)
#> Error in (function (classes, fdef, mtable) {    methods <- .findInheritedMethods(classes, fdef, mtable)    if (length(methods) == 1L)         return(methods[[1L]])    else if (length(methods) == 0L) {        cnames <- paste0("\"", vapply(classes, as.character,             ""), "\"", collapse = ", ")        stop(gettextf("unable to find an inherited method for function %s for signature %s",             sQuote(fdef@generic), sQuote(cnames)), domain = NA)    }    else stop("Internal error in finding inherited methods; didn't return a unique method",         domain = NA)})(list(structure("IncrementsRelative", package = "crmPack"),     "function"), new("nonstandardGenericFunction", .Data = function (increments,     data, ...) {    ans <- {        standardGeneric("maxDose")    }    .valueClassTest(ans, "numeric", "maxDose")}, generic = structure("maxDose", package = "crmPack"), package = "crmPack",     group = list(), valueClass = "numeric", signature = c("increments",     "data"), default = NULL, skeleton = (function (increments,         data, ...)     stop("invalid call in method dispatch to 'maxDose' (no default method)",         domain = NA))(increments, data, ...)), <environment>): unable to find an inherited method for function ‘maxDose’ for signature ‘"IncrementsRelative", "function"’

# Define the rule which will be used to select the next best dose
# based on the class 'NextBestNCRM'
myNextBest <- NextBestNCRM(target=c(0.2, 0.35),
                           overdose=c(0.35, 1),
                           maxOverdoseProb=0.25)

# Calculate the next best dose
doseRecommendation <- nextBest(myNextBest,
                               doselimit=nextMaxDose,
                               samples=samples, model=model, data=data)
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'doselimit' in selecting a method for function 'nextBest': object 'nextMaxDose' not found

# Define the rule which will be used to select the next cohort size
# based on the class 'CohortSizeConst'
mySize <- CohortSizeConst(size=3)

# Determine the cohort size for the next cohort
sizeRecommendation <- size(mySize, dose=doseRecommendation$value, data = data)
#> Error in size(mySize, dose = doseRecommendation$value, data = data): object 'doseRecommendation' not found

# Rule for having safety window length with constant safety window parameters
myWindowLength <- SafetyWindowConst(patientGap = c(7,3),
                                    patientFollow = 7,
                                    patientFollowMin = 14)

# Determine the safety window parameters for the next cohort
windowLength(myWindowLength, size=sizeRecommendation)
#> Error in checkHT(n, dx <- dim(x)): object 'sizeRecommendation' not found
